items.title: AtiFLOW v2.0 ‚Äì MTS Tablet
items.text: AtiFLOW v2.0 is an industrial tablet application for the Material Transport System (MTS). It is used by floor operators (Requesters) at fixed workstations to order materials, request containers, schedule trolley returns, monitor request status, visualise staging areas, and view live inventory ‚Äî all driven by Autonomous Mobile Robots (AMRs).

items.title: Target Device
items.text:
Property Value Screen 1024 √ó 640 px landscape Touch target minimum 44 px (WCAG 2.1 AA) Orientation Landscape only Input method Touch (no hover dependency) Network Always-connected (MTS-PROD)

The layout is not a responsive breakpoint design ‚Äî it is fixed for the single target screen. All page dimensions are calculated around a 52 px top bar and 60 px bottom navigation, leaving 528 px of usable height inside the scrollable area.

items.title: Tech Stack
items.text: Layer Technology Framework React 18 + TypeScript Build tool Vite 5 UI library Material UI (MUI) v5 Routing React Router v6 (BrowserRouter) State React Context API (AppContext) Fonts Inter (Google Fonts) Icons Material Icons (@mui/icons-material)

items.title: Project Setup
items.text: Tool Version / Config Node.js LTS (18+) Package manager npm / bun Build tool Vite 5 TypeScript Strict mode Linter ESLint (Vite default + React hooks)

items.title: vite.config.ts
items.text: Standard Vite React plugin configuration. No custom port, no proxy ‚Äî the app connects to a mock data layer in development. In production, API calls would replace mock imports.

items.title: index.html
items.text:
<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
  <head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8" />
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" />
    <title>mts-tablet</title>
  </head>
  <body>
    <div id="root"></div>
    <script type="module" src="/src/main.tsx"></script>
  </body>
</html>

The <meta name="viewport"> tag ensures correct scaling on the tablet's display. The app does not use the Figma capture script in production ‚Äî it was only present temporarily for design handoff.

items.title: src/main.tsx
items.text: Standard React 18 ReactDOM.createRoot render. Mounts <App /> into #root.

items.title: Application Root ‚Äì src/App.tsx
items.text:
App.tsx composes the entire application:

App
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ThemeProvider (theme from src/theme.ts)
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ CssBaseline
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ AppProvider (context from AppContext.tsx)
            ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ BrowserRouter
                ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ AppRoutes

items.title: AuthGuard
items.text:
function AuthGuard({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) {
  const { user } = useApp();
  if (!user) return <Navigate to="/login" replace />;
  return <>{children}</>;
}

AuthGuard wraps the entire /requester route subtree. Any navigation to a protected route while unauthenticated redirects to /login. After login, the user is sent to /requester/create.

items.title: Route Structure
items.text:
<Routes>
  <Route path="/login"       element={user ? <Navigate to="/requester/create" /> : <LoginPage />} />
  <Route path="/requester"   element={<AuthGuard><RequesterLayout /></AuthGuard>}>
    <Route index             element={<Navigate to="create" />} />
    <Route path="create"     element={<CreateRequestPage />} />
    <Route path="material"   element={<MaterialSelectionPage />} />
    <Route path="checkout"   element={<CheckoutPage />} />
    <Route path="container"  element={<ContainerSelectionPage />} />
    <Route path="container-checkout" element={<ContainerCheckoutPage />} />
    <Route path="return-trolley"     element={<ReturnTrolleyPage />} />
    <Route path="requests"   element={<MyRequestsPage />} />
    <Route path="staging"    element={<StagingAreaPage />} />
    <Route path="inventory"  element={<InventoryPage />} />
  </Route>
  <Route path="*"            element={<Navigate to="/login" />} />
</Routes>

The /requester route renders RequesterLayout as its element ‚Äî this is the shell that provides the header and bottom navigation. All child routes render into the <Outlet /> inside RequesterLayout.

items.title: RequesterLayout.tsx
items.text:
<Box sx={{ display: 'flex', flexDirection: 'column', height: '100vh', overflow: 'hidden' }}>
  <TabletHeader />
  <Box sx={{
    mt: '52px',    // offset for fixed header
    mb: '60px',    // offset for fixed bottom nav
    flex: 1,
    minHeight: 0,  // CRITICAL: allows flex child to shrink for scrolling
    overflow: 'hidden',
    display: 'flex',
    flexDirection: 'column',
    bgcolor: 'background.default',
  }}>
    <Outlet />   // ‚Üê page renders here
  </Box>
  <BottomNav />
</Box>

items.title: The minHeight: 0 Pattern
items.text:
This is the most important layout rule in the application. Every flex container in the scroll chain must have minHeight: 0 ‚Äî otherwise a flex child with overflow: auto cannot shrink below its content height, preventing scrollbars from working and pushing fixed footer bars off-screen.

The required pattern for every page:

{/* Outer page box ‚Äî fills the layout outlet */}
<Box sx={{ display: 'flex', flexDirection: 'column', flex: 1, minHeight: 0, overflow: 'hidden' }}>

  {/* Fixed sub-header ‚Äî never scrolls */}
  <Box sx={{ ..., flexShrink: 0 }}>
    <IconButton>Back</IconButton>
    <Typography>Page Title</Typography>
  </Box>

  {/* Scrollable content area */}
  <Box sx={{ flex: 1, minHeight: 0, overflow: 'auto', p: 2.5 }}>
    {/* page content */}
  </Box>

  {/* Fixed submit bar ‚Äî never scrolls */}
  <Box sx={{ p: 2, borderTop: '1px solid', borderColor: 'divider', flexShrink: 0 }}>
    <Button>Submit</Button>
  </Box>

</Box>

Omitting minHeight: 0 on either the outer box or the scrollable content box will cause layout overflow on the 528px viewport.

items.title: TabletHeader.tsx
items.text:
• position: fixed MUI AppBar at zIndex: 1200
  • Height: 52px (forced via minHeight: '52px !important' on Toolbar)
  • Contains: brand logo, station name, workflow selector dropdown, connection status chip, operator avatar
  • The workflow selector uses MUI Select directly in the header ‚Äî changing it calls setActiveWorkflow() on AppContext, instantly updating the active workflow across all pages
  • Station name has maxWidth: 180, overflow: 'hidden', textOverflow: 'ellipsis' to prevent overflow on long names
  • Renders null if !user || !activeWorkflow (during login flow)

items.title: BottomNav.tsx
items.text:
• position: fixed MUI Paper at zIndex: 1100
  • Height: 60px
  • 4 navigation items:
  • Create Request (/requester/create) ‚Äî shows cart count Badge when cart.length > 0
  • My Requests (/requester/requests)
  • Staging Area (/requester/staging)
  • Inventory (/requester/inventory)
  • Active tab detected via pathname.startsWith(item.path) ‚Äî correctly highlights the parent tab even on sub-routes like /requester/material (which highlights "Create Request")

items.title: Navigation Patterns
items.text:
Three navigation patterns are used:

  1. useNavigate(path) ‚Äî direct programmatic navigation (after form submit, button click)
  2. useNavigate(-1) ‚Äî browser history back (Back arrow buttons in sub-headers)
  3. <Navigate to="..." replace /> ‚Äî redirect without history entry (auth guard, post-login)

items.title: Sub-route Flow (not using nested routes)
items.text:
Some pages have multi-step flows implemented within the same route using local useState:

  • ReturnTrolleyPage: method = null | 'qr' | 'details' controls which view renders
  • StagingAreaPage: selectedArea = null | StagingArea controls list vs. detail view

This keeps the URL stable (no back/forward navigation between sub-steps), which is appropriate for touch-device industrial UIs where back-button confusion must be minimised.

items.title: Data Layer
items.text:
Currently all data is mocked in src/data/mock.ts. The mock layer exports:

Export Type Description mockWorkflows Workflow[] 3 workflows with different strategies mockDeviceUser DeviceUser Single operator with all 3 workflows mockMaterials MaterialSKU[] 4 SKUs with 9 Sub-SKU types total mockContainers Container[] 3 container types (Trolley/Pallet/Bin) with 7 subtypes mockStagingAreas StagingArea[] 2 areas (4√ó10 and 3√ó8 grid) mockRequests Request[] 4 requests across different workflows/statuses mockInventory InventoryRow[] 8 rows of inventory data

In production, these imports would be replaced with API calls. The function signatures of the context actions (addToCart, setContainerCart, etc.) are designed to remain unchanged.

items.title: Data Models
items.text: All TypeScript interfaces are defined in src/types.ts. Mock data fixtures are in src/data/mock.ts.

items.title: SubSKUType
items.text:
A specific variant of a material SKU. This is the atomic unit that operators order.

interface SubSKUType {
  id: string;             // e.g. "sst-01"
  name: string;           // e.g. "Sub-SKU Type 1"
  code: string;           // e.g. "WGT-A-T1"  (monospace display)
  available: number;      // units currently available for ordering
  reserved: number;       // units reserved (not orderable)
  maxQty: number;         // maximum quantity an operator can order in one request
  active: boolean;        // whether this sub-SKU is active in the system
  inPreProcessing: boolean; // true = manufacture is complete but pre-processing
                            // (e.g. cleaning, quality check) is not yet done.
                            // These cannot be ordered even if available > 0.
}

Business logic: - An item is orderable only if available > 0 AND !inPreProcessing - inPreProcessing items display an amber "Pre-Processing" chip - available === 0 items display a grey "Unavailable" chip - Blocked items have opacity: 0.6, quantity stepper is disabled, Add button is disabled

items.title: MaterialSKU
items.text:
A parent SKU grouping multiple Sub-SKU types.

interface MaterialSKU {
  id: string;
  name: string;           // e.g. "Widget A"
  code: string;           // e.g. "WGT-A"
  subSkuTypes: SubSKUType[];
}

The UI flattens MaterialSKU[] into a list of FlatSST objects (in MaterialSelectionPage) for display. The parent SKU name is kept alongside the sub-type for context.

items.title: ContainerType
items.text:
type ContainerType = 'trolley' | 'pallet' | 'bin';

Three physical container types. Each maps to a display label: - 'trolley' ‚Üí 'Trolley' - 'pallet' ‚Üí 'Pallet' - 'bin' ‚Üí 'Bin'

items.title: ContainerSubtype
items.text:
A specific variant of a container (e.g. Heavy Trolley vs Light Trolley).

interface ContainerSubtype {
  id: string;           // e.g. "cst-01"
  name: string;         // e.g. "Heavy Trolley"
  available: number;    // units currently available
}

items.title: Container
items.text:
A container type with all its subtypes.

interface Container {
  id: string;
  type: ContainerType;
  subtypes: ContainerSubtype[];
}

items.title: CartItem
items.text:
A material item staged in the checkout cart.

interface CartItem {
  subSkuTypeId: string;       // unique key (matches SubSKUType.id)
  subSkuTypeName: string;     // display name, e.g. "Widget A ‚Äì Sub-SKU Type 1"
  skuName: string;            // parent SKU name for grouping display
  quantity: number;           // currently selected quantity
  maxQty: number;             // max allowed (carried from SubSKUType.maxQty)
}

items.title: ContainerCartItem
items.text:
A container item staged for the container checkout flow.

interface ContainerCartItem {
  containerId: string;          // parent Container.id
  containerType: ContainerType;
  subtypeId: string;            // ContainerSubtype.id
  subtypeName: string;          // e.g. "Heavy Trolley"
  quantity: number;
}

items.title: StagingCell
items.text:
A single cell in a staging area grid.

interface StagingCell {
  id: string;                              // e.g. "cell-0"
  row: number;                             // 0-based row index
  col: number;                             // 0-based column index
  status: 'empty' | 'occupied' | 'reserved';
  material?: string;                       // e.g. "Widget A ‚Äì T1" (if occupied)
  trolleyId?: string;                      // e.g. "TR-101" (if occupied)
}

Cell status in the staging grid UI adds a fourth state 'maintenance' locally within StagingAreaPage (not in this type, managed in local CellEdit state). The type system is extended in the page component.

items.title: StagingArea
items.text:
A named staging area with a grid of cells.

interface StagingArea {
  id: string;           // e.g. "sa-01"
  name: string;         // e.g. "Staging Area 1"
  rows: number;         // grid rows
  cols: number;         // grid columns
  cells: StagingCell[]; // array of rows*cols cells
}

Grid addressing uses letter rows (A, B, C...) and number columns (1, 2, 3...) in the UI. Cell (row=0, col=2) displays as "A3".

items.title: Request
items.text:
A submitted request (material, container, or return trolley).

interface Request {
  id: string;         // e.g. "req-001"
  type: 'material' | 'container' | 'return_trolley';
  status: 'pending' | 'awaiting_confirmation' | 'in_progress'
        | 'completed' | 'failed' | 'breakdown';
  createdAt: string;  // display timestamp, e.g. "10:32 AM"
  items: string;      // human-readable summary, e.g. "Widget A ‚Äì T1 √ó 2"
  workflow: string;   // workflow display name
  workflowId: string; // workflow ID for filtering (must match Workflow.id)
}

Status descriptions:

Status Display label Colour Meaning pending Pending Amber #F57C00 Submitted, waiting for AMR assignment awaiting_confirmation Awaiting Blue #1565C0 Waiting for dispatcher confirmation (manual mode) in_progress In Progress Teal #009688 AMR is actively fulfilling the request completed Completed Green #2E7D32 Request fulfilled failed Failed Red #C62828 Request failed (AMR error, timeout, etc.) breakdown Breakdown Purple #6A1B9A AMR breakdown mid-fulfilment

items.title: InventoryRow
items.text:
A single row in the live inventory table.

interface InventoryRow {
  sku: string;            // Parent SKU name
  subSkuType: string;     // Sub-SKU type name
  produced: number;       // Total units manufactured
  preProcessing: number;  // Units in pre-processing (not yet available)
  available: number;      // Units available for ordering
  reserved: number;       // Units reserved by pending requests
  inTransit: number;      // Units currently being transported by AMRs
  consumed: number;       // Units consumed at workstations
  total: number;          // Total units (= produced)
}

items.title: Workflow
items.text:
A named workflow configuration that scopes all requests.

interface Workflow {
  id: string;
  name: string;
  assignmentStrategy: 'request-based' | 'on-route';
  confirmationMode: 'auto' | 'manual';
}

See State Management ‚Äì activeWorkflow for the business logic of each strategy.

items.title: DeviceUser
items.text:
The authenticated operator profile bound to this physical device.

interface DeviceUser {
  id: string;
  username: string;
  stationName: string;     // e.g. "Assembly Line A ‚Äì Requester"
                           // Displayed in TabletHeader with ellipsis overflow
  deviceName: string;      // e.g. "Tablet-R01"
  role: 'requester' | 'dispatcher';
  workflows: Workflow[];           // Available workflows for this station
  stagingAreaIds: string[];        // Staging areas this device can access
}

items.title: Design System
items.text: The AtiFLOW MTS Tablet design system is built on top of Material UI (MUI) v5 with a custom theme defined in src/theme.ts. All design tokens are applied globally via ThemeProvider in App.tsx.

items.title: Primary Brand Colours
items.text: Token Hex Usage PRIMARY #009688 (Teal 500) Primary actions, active states, available stock indicators, primary buttons primary.dark #00796B (Teal 700) Hover state for primary primary.light #4DB6AC (Teal 300) Connection status chip, lighter accents TOPBAR_BG #263238 (Blue Grey 900) App bar background, login page background

items.title: Background Colours
items.text: Token Hex Usage background.default #F5F7F9 Page background (all content areas) background.paper #FFFFFF Cards, dialogs, sub-headers, bottom nav

items.title: Text Colours
items.text: Token Hex Usage text.primary #1A2332 Body text, headings, labels text.secondary #637381 Subtitles, captions, helper text text.disabled MUI default Disabled states, monospace codes

items.title: Status & Semantic Colours
items.text: Colour Hex Context Teal / Primary #009688 Available, occupied (staging), in-progress Amber / Warning #F57C00 / #E65100 Pre-processing, reserved (staging), pending, Dispatcher required Blue / Info #1565C0 Containers, in-transit, awaiting confirmation, edit indicators Purple / Return #6A1B9A Return Trolley flow (all pages), breakdown status Green / Success #2E7D32 Completed status Red / Error #C62828 / #E53935 Failed, maintenance, delete actions Divider #E8ECEF Table separators, section dividers Row hover #F9FAFB Table row hover background

items.title: Component-Specific Colour Usage
items.text: Component Background Text/Border Condition Available chip rgba(0,150,136,0.08) #009688 available > 0 && !inPreProcessing Pre-Processing chip rgba(245,124,0,0.08) #E65100 inPreProcessing === true Unavailable chip #F5F5F5 #9E9E9E available === 0 Pending status #FFF8E1 #F57C00 Request status Awaiting status #E3F2FD #1565C0 Request status In Progress status rgba(0,150,136,0.1) #009688 Request status Completed status #E8F5E9 #2E7D32 Request status Failed status #FFEBEE #C62828 Request status Breakdown status #F3E5F5 #6A1B9A Request status

items.title: Typography
items.text:
Font family: "Inter", "Roboto", "Helvetica", "Arial", sans-serif

The font is loaded via Google Fonts (configured in main.tsx/index.html). Inter is chosen for its industrial clarity and excellent legibility at small sizes on screens.

items.title: Type Scale (MUI overrides)
items.text: Variant Weight Size Usage h5 700 MUI default (~1.5rem) Large section headings h6 600 MUI default (~1.25rem) Page titles, dialog titles subtitle1 500 MUI default Section sub-headings subtitle2 600 MUI default Card headings body2 400 0.8125rem (13px) Secondary body text, helper text caption 400 0.75rem (12px) Labels, metadata, timestamps

items.title: Custom Typography in Components
items.text:
Many components use inline sx typography because they deviate slightly from the MUI scale for pixel-perfect density:

Usage fontSize fontWeight Sub-header page titles 1rem 700 Card headings 0.875rem‚Äì0.9375rem 600‚Äì700 Item names in lists 0.875rem 600 Monospace codes inherited + fontFamily: 'monospace' 400 Micro labels / status 0.7rem 500‚Äì600 App bar brand name 0.8rem 700 App bar station name 0.65rem 400

items.title: Spacing System
items.text:
MUI's default 8px grid is used throughout. Common spacing values:

MUI unit px Usage 0.5 4px Tight chip/icon gaps 1 8px Compact gaps within components 1.5 12px Standard gap between form fields 2 16px Card padding (compact), section gaps 2.5 20px Standard card padding (px), content area padding 3 24px Dialog padding, large card padding 3.5 28px Login card inner padding 4 32px Success screen padding

items.title: Border Radius
items.text: MUI token px Usage shape.borderRadius 6 Global default (all MUI components inherit) borderRadius: 1 4px Inline steppers, small chips borderRadius: 1.5 6px (= base) Standard cards, buttons, outlined inputs borderRadius: 2 8px Larger action cards (return trolley options) borderRadius: 3 12px Primary action zones (Order Material card) borderRadius: '50%' circular Avatar, success state circle borderRadius: 4 16px Chip global override MuiDialog.paper 10 Dialog containers

items.title: Touch Targets
items.text:
All interactive elements must meet the 44px minimum touch target requirement for industrial gloved-hand usage. This is enforced via MUI theme overrides:

MuiButton: {
  styleOverrides: {
    root: { minHeight: 44 },
  },
},
MuiTab: {
  styleOverrides: {
    root: { minHeight: 44 },
  },
},

Note: Inline IconButton components within dense list rows use width: 36, height: 36 ‚Äî these are in tight-fit contexts where larger targets would crowd the layout. Full-width action buttons always meet 44px.

items.title: Elevation & Shadow
items.text:
MUI's elevation system is used sparingly:

Component elevation Notes AppBar 0 Custom border: 1px solid rgba(255,255,255,0.08) BottomNav Paper 0 Custom border: borderTop: '1px solid divider' Login Paper 0 Glassmorphism: bgcolor: rgba(255,255,255,0.05), backdropFilter: blur(8px) All cards variant="outlined" No shadow by default Primary action card hover ‚Äî boxShadow: '0 8px 32px rgba(0,150,136,0.12)' Button containedPrimary 0 boxShadow: none overridden to remove default MUI elevation

items.title: Dividers
items.text: Divider components use the theme default colour #E8ECEF. Sub-header bars use borderBottom: '1px solid', borderColor: 'divider' consistently.

items.title: MUI Component Overrides Summary
items.text:
// From src/theme.ts
MuiCssBaseline: {

}

  containedPrimary: { boxShadow: 'none' }
}
MuiOutlinedInput: {
  fontSize: '0.9375rem',
  fieldset borderColor: '#DDE1E6',
  input padding: '12px 14px'
}

  borderRadius: 4,
  fontWeight: 500
}
MuiTableHead cell: {
  fontWeight: 600,
  fontSize: '0.8125rem',
  backgroundColor: '#F8F9FA',
  borderBottom: '2px solid #E8ECEF',

}
MuiTableCell: {

  padding: '10px 16px',

items.title: Iconography
items.text:
All icons are from @mui/icons-material (Material Icons Outlined style). Key icon-to-concept mapping:

Icon Concept WidgetsOutlined Order Material LocalShippingOutlined Return Trolley Inventory2Outlined Containers / Inventory CalendarViewMonth Staging Area ListAlt My Requests / Manual entry QrCodeScanner QR code scanning AddCircleOutline Create Request (bottom nav) ShoppingCartOutlined Cart / Checkout WorkspacesOutlined Workflow CheckCircle Success state EditOutlined Manage/Edit mode VisibilityOutlined View mode

items.title: Dark Mode
items.text: The application does not support dark mode. The login page uses a dark background (TOPBAR_BG = '#263238') with a semi-transparent glass card, but this is not a theme toggle ‚Äî it is the fixed login screen style.

items.title: Primary Navigation (BottomNav)
items.text:
The BottomNav is always visible once logged in. It provides access to the 4 main sections:

[+ Create Request]  [üìã My Requests]  [üóì Staging Area]  [üì¶ Inventory]
   /requester/create   /requester/requests  /requester/staging  /requester/inventory

Active tab detection uses pathname.startsWith(item.path). This means: - Navigating to /requester/material highlights "Create Request" - Navigating to /requester/checkout highlights "Create Request" - Navigating to /requester/return-trolley highlights "Create Request"

Cart badge: When cart.length > 0, the Create Request tab icon shows a teal Badge with the item count.

items.title: Sub-page Navigation (Sub-headers)
items.text:
Pages that are reached via a flow (not directly from BottomNav) have a fixed sub-header with a back arrow (ArrowBackIcon). These use:

// History back (from a specific previous page)
<IconButton onClick={() => navigate(-1)}>

// Internal state back (no history change)
<IconButton onClick={() => setMethod(null)}>

items.title: Workflow Context (TabletHeader)
items.text:
The workflow selector in the header is always accessible. Changing it: 1. Updates activeWorkflow in context 2. Immediately re-renders all pages that read activeWorkflow 3. MyRequestsPage filter changes to show the new workflow's requests

This is designed so supervisors or multi-workflow stations can switch context without logging out.

items.title: Flow 1: Order Material
items.text:
/requester/create
  ‚Üí [Start Ordering] ‚Üí /requester/material
      ‚Üí [Add items to cart]
          ‚Üí [Checkout button (header or banner)] ‚Üí /requester/checkout
              ‚Üí [Review + optional containers + return trolley toggle]
                  ‚Üí [Submit Request] ‚Üí Confirm dialog ‚Üí Success screen
                      ‚Üí [New Request] ‚Üí /requester/create (cart cleared)
                      ‚Üí [View My Requests] ‚Üí /requester/requests

Back navigation: - /requester/checkout ‚Üí navigate(-1) ‚Üí /requester/material (cart preserved) - /requester/material ‚Üí navigate(-1) ‚Üí /requester/create (cart preserved)

items.title: Flow 2: Order Containers (dedicated flow)
items.text:
/requester/container          (no BottomNav entry ‚Äî accessed directly or future link)
  ‚Üí [Select subtypes + quantities]
      ‚Üí [Checkout button] ‚Üí /requester/container-checkout
          ‚Üí [Submit Container Request] ‚Üí Confirm dialog ‚Üí Success screen
              ‚Üí [New Request] ‚Üí /requester/create (containerCart cleared)

items.title: Flow 3: Return Trolley
items.text:
/requester/create
  ‚Üí [Return Trolley zone] ‚Üí /requester/return-trolley
      ‚Üí Method Selection
          ‚Üí [Scan QR Code] ‚Üí QR flow (local state)
              ‚Üí Scan simulation ‚Üí DetailCard shown
                  ‚Üí [Confirm Return Pickup] ‚Üí Confirm dialog ‚Üí Success
          ‚Üí [Enter Container Details] ‚Üí Manual flow (local state)
              ‚Üí Fill form ‚Üí [Look Up] ‚Üí DetailCard shown
                  ‚Üí [Confirm Return Pickup] ‚Üí Confirm dialog ‚Üí Success

items.title: Flow 4: Monitor Requests
items.text:
/requester/requests
  ‚Üí View all requests for active workflow
  ‚Üí Filter by status tab
  ‚Üí (read-only ‚Äî no further navigation)

items.title: Flow 5: Inspect Staging Area
items.text:
/requester/staging (Area List)
  ‚Üí [Tap area card] ‚Üí Area Detail (local state)
      ‚Üí [View Grid] or [View List] toggle
      ‚Üí [View | Manage] toggle
          ‚Üí Manage: [Tap cell] ‚Üí Edit Cell dialog
              ‚Üí [Save Changes] ‚Üí cell updates in place
  ‚Üí [Back arrow] ‚Üí Area List

items.title: Flow 6: Check Inventory
items.text:
/requester/inventory
  ‚Üí [Search by SKU name]
  ‚Üí Table filtered in real time
  ‚Üí (read-only)

items.title: Quantity Steppers
items.text:
Used in: MaterialSelectionPage (grid + list), CheckoutPage (cart items + inline containers), ContainerSelectionPage, ReturnTrolleyPage (does not have one).

Standard pattern: 

[‚àí] value [+]
- ‚àí disabled at qty <= 1 (or at minimum allowed value) - + disabled at qty >= maxQty (or when unavailable) - borderRadius: 0 on both buttons for seamless inline appearance - The value display is not an input ‚Äî it is Typography only. There is no direct text entry for quantities.

items.title: Confirm Dialogs
items.text:
All destructive or irreversible actions (submit request, submit container order, confirm return pickup) use a confirmation dialog pattern:

[Dialog title]
[Summary of what will happen + key data]

[Cancel]    [Confirm & Submit]
  • maxWidth="xs" fullWidth ‚Äî 480px max on desktop, full-width on small screens
  • Cancel is left, confirm is right (standard MUI DialogActions order)
  • borderRadius: 10 on dialog paper (from theme override)

items.title: Success Screens
items.text:
All final submissions show a full-page success state (no navigation change ‚Äî same route):

          ‚óè (coloured circle)
          Action Completed!

          [descriptive message]

    [View My Requests]    [New Request / Home]
  • Left button: secondary action (view history)
  • Right button: primary action (start fresh)

Success screen circle colours: - Material checkout: Teal rgba(0,150,136,0.1) with teal CheckCircle - Container checkout: Blue rgba(21,101,192,0.1) with blue CheckCircle - Return trolley: Purple rgba(106,27,154,0.1) with purple CheckCircle

items.title: Loading/Async States
items.text:
Only one async interaction exists in the prototype: QR scan simulation (1.2 second delay).

Pattern: - Button disabled (disabled={qrScanning}) - Button text changes ("Scanning‚Ä¶") - Custom disabled style: '&.Mui-disabled': { bgcolor: 'rgba(106,27,154,0.5)', color: '#fff' } - Animated pulse indicator below button during scan

items.title: Collapse Sections
items.text: CheckoutPage uses MUI Collapse for the "Add Containers" section. The header row is fully tappable (not just an icon) and shows a summary preview when collapsed with data.

items.title: AMR Integration Points
items.text:
The following UI elements represent real AMR integration points that are mocked in the prototype:

Element Location Real behaviour QR scan button ReturnTrolleyPage Opens device camera, decodes QR, fetches container record "AMR En Route" indicator MyRequestsPage in_progress rows WebSocket/polling update from MTS backend Success screen messages CheckoutPage, ContainerCheckoutPage, ReturnTrolleyPage Triggered by backend confirmation Return trolley chip text CheckoutPage Reads current assignmentStrategy for the request's workflow "awaiting_confirmation" status MyRequestsPage Manually confirmed by Dispatcher role

items.title: Animation & Transition Summary
items.text: Animation Applied to CSS Card hover scale Staging grid cells (manage mode) transform: scale(1.12) Card hover shadow Material cards, area cards, container cards boxShadow on hover Status pulse AMR En Route dot, QR scanning icon @keyframes pulse: opacity 1‚Üí0.3‚Üí1 Border colour transition Cart item cards, container selection cards transition: 'border-color 0.15s' General card transition Most interactive cards transition: 'all 0.15s'

items.title: Touch Targets
items.text: All primary interactive elements meet the 44px minimum (enforced via MUI theme). Some inline stepper buttons use 36px ‚Äî acceptable in context where they are paired with other controls.

items.title: Keyboard Support
items.text:
• Enter key in LoginPage submits the form
  • All MUI interactive elements support keyboard navigation (Tab, Enter, Space, Arrow keys)
  • Dialogs trap focus correctly (MUI default behaviour)

items.title: Colour Contrast
items.text:
• Body text #1A2332 on #F5F7F9 background ‚Äî high contrast
  • Status chips use colour + text label (not colour alone) for accessibility
  • Icons are always accompanied by text labels in important contexts

items.title: Screen Reader
items.text:
• MUI components use ARIA attributes by default
  • aria-label should be added to icon-only buttons in production (currently not set on back arrows, delete icons, etc.)

items.title: State Management
items.text:
All global state lives in a single React Context: AppContext (src/context/AppContext.tsx). It is provided at the root of the application by AppProvider wrapping the entire router.

Access it in any component with:

import { useApp } from '../../context/AppContext';
const { user, cart, addToCart } = useApp();

items.title: State Shape
items.text:
interface AppState {
  user: DeviceUser | null;          // null = not logged in
  activeWorkflow: Workflow | null;  // null = not logged in
  cart: CartItem[];                 // material items selected for checkout
  containerCart: ContainerCartItem[]; // container items (separate flow)
  returnTrolleyEnabled: boolean;    // toggle on CheckoutPage
}

items.title: user: DeviceUser | null
items.text:
The currently authenticated device operator.

  • Initial value: null (unauthenticated)
  • Set by: login() action (sets to mockDeviceUser with the entered username applied)
  • Cleared by: logout()
  • Used by: AuthGuard, TabletHeader, MyRequestsPage (workflow filtering)

The user.workflows array is the source of truth for which workflows are available in the header dropdown.

items.title: activeWorkflow: Workflow | null
items.text:
The currently selected workflow. All material requests, container orders, and return trolleys are scoped to this workflow.

  • Initial value: null
  • Set by: login() (auto-selects first workflow), setActiveWorkflow() (via header dropdown)
  • Cleared by: logout()
  • Used by: TabletHeader (dropdown), CreateRequestPage (info strip), MaterialSelectionPage (header caption), CheckoutPage (summary, confirm dialog, return trolley chip text), ContainerCheckoutPage (header caption, confirm dialog), ReturnTrolleyPage (confirm dialog, DetailCard), MyRequestsPage (workflow-scoped request filter)

items.title: Workflow Properties
items.text:
interface Workflow {
  id: string;
  name: string;
  assignmentStrategy: 'request-based' | 'on-route';
  confirmationMode: 'auto' | 'manual';
}
assignmentStrategy Effect 'request-based' AMR trip created immediately on submission. Success message: "Trip will be fulfilled immediately by an AMR." Return trolley chip: "Trip scheduled immediately on delivery." 'on-route' AMR trip created only when the AMR scans the trolley QR code (FIFO queue). Success message: "Trip will be assigned when the AMR scans the trolley QR code." Return trolley chip: "AMR will collect on QR scan (FIFO)." confirmationMode Effect 'auto' No dispatcher needed. CreateRequestPage info strip shows "Not required." 'manual' Dispatcher must confirm the request. CreateRequestPage info strip shows "Required" in amber (#E65100).

items.title: cart: CartItem[]
items.text:
The material items staged for submission.

  • Initial value: []
  • Modified by: addToCart(), updateCartQty(), removeFromCart(), clearCart()
  • Used by: MaterialSelectionPage (in-cart state), CheckoutPage (review list), BottomNav (cart badge count), CreateRequestPage (cart banner + Checkout button)
interface CartItem {
  subSkuTypeId: string;     // unique key
  subSkuTypeName: string;   // display name "Widget A ‚Äì Sub-SKU Type 1"
  skuName: string;          // parent SKU name
  quantity: number;         // current selected quantity
  maxQty: number;           // max allowed quantity (from SubSKUType)
}

items.title: Cart Actions
items.text: Action Signature Behaviour addToCart (item: CartItem) => void If item with same subSkuTypeId already exists, increments quantity (capped at maxQty). Otherwise appends. updateCartQty (subSkuTypeId: string, qty: number) => void Replaces quantity directly ‚Äî used by CheckoutPage quantity stepper. removeFromCart (subSkuTypeId: string) => void Removes item from cart. clearCart () => void Empties cart entirely ‚Äî called after successful submission.

items.title: containerCart: ContainerCartItem[]
items.text:
Container items selected in ContainerSelectionPage. Separate from cart because containers go through a different checkout flow.

  • Initial value: []
  • Set by: setContainerCart(items) ‚Äî called at once with the full selection array
  • Cleared by: clearContainerCart() ‚Äî called after successful submission
  • Used by: ContainerCheckoutPage
interface ContainerCartItem {
  containerId: string;        // container type ID
  containerType: ContainerType; // 'trolley' | 'pallet' | 'bin'
  subtypeId: string;          // subtype ID
  subtypeName: string;        // display name
  quantity: number;
}

items.title: returnTrolleyEnabled: boolean
items.text:
Controls whether an empty trolley return is automatically scheduled alongside the material request.

  • Initial value: true (on by default)
  • Set by: setReturnTrolley(val: boolean) ‚Äî controlled by the Switch in CheckoutPage
  • Persisted across sessions: No ‚Äî resets on logout (currently resets on login only via context re-initialisation)
  • Used by: CheckoutPage (toggle UI + return trolley section visibility + success message text)

items.title: Actions Reference
items.text:
interface AppContextValue extends AppState {
  login: (username: string, password: string) => boolean;
  logout: () => void;
  setActiveWorkflow: (w: Workflow) => void;
  addToCart: (item: CartItem) => void;
  updateCartQty: (subSkuTypeId: string, qty: number) => void;
  removeFromCart: (subSkuTypeId: string) => void;
  clearCart: () => void;
  setContainerCart: (items: ContainerCartItem[]) => void;
  clearContainerCart: () => void;
  setReturnTrolley: (val: boolean) => void;
}

items.title: login(username, password): boolean
items.text:
Mock login ‚Äî accepts any non-empty string pair.

const login = (username: string, password: string): boolean => {
  if (username.trim() && password.trim()) {
    setUser({ ...mockDeviceUser, username });
    setActiveWorkflowState(mockDeviceUser.workflows[0] ?? null);
    return true;
  }
  return false;
};
  • Returns true on success (caller navigates to /requester/create)
  • Returns false on failure (caller shows error alert)
  • The username field is overridden with the entered value so the header displays the actual input

items.title: logout()
items.text:
const logout = () => {
  setUser(null);
  setActiveWorkflowState(null);
  setCart([]);
  setContainerCartState([]);
};

Clears all user state. Does not reset returnTrolleyEnabled (it will be reset next time context re-initialises on next login via useState(true) initial value).

items.title: State Flow Diagram
items.text:
Login
  ‚îî‚îÄ> login() ‚îÄ‚îÄ> user set, activeWorkflow set ‚îÄ‚îÄ> navigate('/requester/create')

CreateRequestPage
  ‚îú‚îÄ> navigate('/requester/material') ‚îÄ‚îÄ> MaterialSelectionPage
  ‚îÇ       ‚îî‚îÄ> addToCart() / removeFromCart()
  ‚îÇ               ‚îî‚îÄ> navigate('/requester/checkout') ‚îÄ‚îÄ> CheckoutPage
  ‚îÇ                       ‚îú‚îÄ> updateCartQty() / removeFromCart()
  ‚îÇ                       ‚îú‚îÄ> setReturnTrolley()
  ‚îÇ                       ‚îú‚îÄ> [inline container add ‚Äì local state only]
  ‚îÇ                       ‚îî‚îÄ> Submit ‚îÄ‚îÄ> clearCart() ‚îÄ‚îÄ> navigate('/requester/create')
  ‚îÇ
  ‚îî‚îÄ> navigate('/requester/return-trolley') ‚îÄ‚îÄ> ReturnTrolleyPage
          ‚îî‚îÄ> [all state local ‚Äì no context writes]

ContainerSelectionPage
  ‚îî‚îÄ> setContainerCart(items) ‚îÄ‚îÄ> navigate('/requester/container-checkout')
          ‚îî‚îÄ> ContainerCheckoutPage
                  ‚îî‚îÄ> Submit ‚îÄ‚îÄ> clearContainerCart() ‚îÄ‚îÄ> navigate('/requester/create')

TabletHeader
  ‚îî‚îÄ> setActiveWorkflow(wf) ‚îÄ‚îÄ> ALL pages re-render with new workflow context

items.title: Local State vs. Context State
items.text:
Not all state lives in context. The following is local to each page (React useState):

Page Local State LoginPage stationCode, password, error MaterialSelectionPage search, quantities (pending input before add), viewMode CheckoutPage confirmOpen, submitted, containerExpanded, addedContainers, selContainerIdx, selSubtypeId, containerQty ContainerSelectionPage tabIdx, quantities, selected (Set of subtypeIds) ContainerCheckoutPage confirmOpen, submitted ReturnTrolleyPage method, resolved, confirmOpen, submitted, qrScanning, containerId, containerTypeIdx, subtypeId, notFound MyRequestsPage tabIdx (filter tab index) StagingAreaPage selectedArea, displayMode, viewLayout, edits, editingCell, savedCount InventoryPage search

items.title: Checkout Page
items.text: Route: /requester/checkout Component: src/pages/requester/CheckoutPage.tsx Auth: Protected Entered from: Material Selection (Checkout button), Create Request (cart banner)

items.title: Purpose
items.text: Allows the operator to review and adjust their cart before submission. Also provides: - Optional inline container add-on (without going to ContainerSelectionPage) - Return trolley scheduling toggle - Order summary - Confirm & Submit flow

items.title: Empty Cart State
items.text:
When cart.length === 0:

                 Your cart is empty.
                [Add Materials]

Navigates to /requester/material.

items.title: Success State (submitted === true)

After confirm:

items.title: Inline Container Add vs. ContainerSelectionPage
items.text:
Two paths exist to add containers: 1. CheckoutPage ‚Üí "Add Containers" (inline, local state) 2. CreateRequestPage ‚Üí not shown ‚Äî containers have their own dedicated route via ContainerSelectionPage ‚Üí ContainerCheckoutPage

The inline approach is for operators who realise mid-order they need containers. It uses local state rather than containerCart context.

items.title: handleAddContainer()
items.text:
const handleAddContainer = () => {
  if (!selSubtypeId) return;
  const subtype = activeContainer.subtypes.find((s) => s.id === selSubtypeId);
  if (!subtype) return;
  setAddedContainers((prev) => {
    const existing = prev.findIndex((c) => c.subtypeId === selSubtypeId);
    if (existing >= 0) {
      return prev.map((c, i) => i === existing ? { ...c, qty: c.qty + containerQty } : c);
    }
    return [...prev, { containerId, containerType, subtypeId, subtypeName, qty: containerQty }];
  });
  setSelSubtypeId('');    // reset picker
  setContainerQty(1);     // reset qty
};

items.title: Selection Toggle
items.text:
const toggleSelect = (subtypeId: string) => {
  setSelected((prev) => {
    const next = new Set(prev);
    if (next.has(subtypeId)) {
      next.delete(subtypeId);
    } else {
      next.add(subtypeId);
    }
    return next;
  });
};

Clicking an unavailable card does nothing (!unavailable && toggleSelect(subtype.id) guard).

items.title: Checkout Transition
items.text:
const handleCheckout = () => {
  const items: ContainerCartItem[] = Array.from(selected).map((subtypeId) => {
    const subtype = activeContainer.subtypes.find((s) => s.id === subtypeId)!;
    return {
      containerId: activeContainer.id,
      containerType: activeContainer.type,
      subtypeId,
      subtypeName: subtype.name,
      quantity: getQty(subtypeId),
    };
  });
  setContainerCart(items);
  navigate('/requester/container-checkout');
};

Important: Only the currently active tab's selections are sent to checkout. Selecting items from Trolley tab, switching to Pallet tab and selecting there, then checking out would only include the Pallet selections. This is because selected is reset on tab switch (setTabIdx(v); setSelected(new Set())).

This is by design ‚Äî a single container order is scoped to one container type.

  • Reads activeWorkflow?.name ‚Äî shows "None selected" if null (should not happen post-login)

items.title: Cart Banner
items.text:
Conditionally rendered only when cart.length > 0:

{cart.length > 0 && (
  <Box sx={{ bgcolor: 'rgba(0,150,136,0.06)', border: '1px solid rgba(0,150,136,0.2)', ... }}>
    <ShoppingCartOutlinedIcon />
    <Typography>{cart.length} item(s) in cart</Typography>
    <Button onClick={() => navigate('/requester/checkout')}>Checkout</Button>
  </Box>
)}

This is the only visual reminder of pending cart items outside of the BottomNav badge. It allows operators who left the cart mid-flow to resume checkout without browsing again.

items.title: Primary Zone ‚Äì Order Material
items.text:
• ButtonBase with flex: 1 and minHeight: 180 ‚Äî takes all available vertical space after other elements
  • Inner card:
  • 80√ó80px teal icon box with WidgetsOutlinedIcon (42px, white)
  • Title "Order Material" ‚Äî fontWeight: 800, 1.25rem
  • Description text
  • 3 flow step chips: "1. Browse", "2. Quantity", "3. Submit"
  • "Start Ordering ‚Üí" contained button (pointerEvents: 'none' ‚Äî the ButtonBase handles the click, not the inner button)
  • Hover state: bgcolor: rgba(0,150,136,0.09), teal borderColor, green glow shadow

items.title: Secondary Zone ‚Äì Return Trolley
items.text:
• Compact ButtonBase row
  • 44√ó44px purple icon box (bgcolor: '#6A1B9A') with LocalShippingOutlinedIcon
  • Title + description
  • Right arrow icon
  • Hover: bgcolor: rgba(106,27,154,0.08), purple border, purple shadow

items.title: Workflow Info Strip
items.text:
Three metadata cells separated by vertical Divider components:

Cell Value source Notes Assignment activeWorkflow?.assignmentStrategy.replace('-', ' ') e.g. "request based" Confirmation activeWorkflow?.confirmationMode "auto" or "manual" Dispatcher Derived from confirmationMode "Required" in #E65100 if manual, "Not required" otherwise

items.title: State
items.text: No local state. Only reads from context: - cart ‚Äî for cart banner visibility + item count - activeWorkflow ‚Äî for all display fields

items.title: Vertical Proportioning
items.text: The page uses a column flex layout (gap: 1.5). The Primary Zone takes flex: 1 ‚Äî it expands to fill remaining space after the workflow strip, cart banner, divider, secondary zone, and info strip. On the 528px viewport with no cart banner, this gives approximately 250‚Äì280px to the primary zone.

items.title: Touch Affordance
items.text: Both action zones are ButtonBase (full-area touch target) rather than a Button component. This means the entire card area ‚Äî not just a button ‚Äî is tappable, which is critical for touch-first industrial UIs.

items.title: Edge Cases
items.text: Scenario Behaviour cart.length === 0 Cart banner not rendered; no visual clutter cart.length > 0 Amber cart banner appears; "Checkout" button navigates directly Long workflow name Chip wraps or truncates with standard Chip overflow activeWorkflow === null All derived values show "‚Äî" gracefully

items.title: Inventory Page
items.text: Route: /requester/inventory Component: src/pages/requester/InventoryPage.tsx Auth: Protected Bottom Nav: "Inventory" tab (index 3)

items.title: Purpose
items.text: Provides a read-only, searchable table of real-time material inventory across all SKU types for the operator's workflow. Operators can verify availability before placing orders and understand the full material lifecycle (produced ‚Üí pre-processing ‚Üí available ‚Üí reserved ‚Üí in transit ‚Üí consumed).

items.title: Layout
items.text:
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ Live Inventory                          ‚îÇ  ‚Üê Header (fixed)
‚îÇ Real-time material availability         ‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§
‚îÇ [47 Available] [8 Reserved] [3 In Transit] [3 Pre-Processing] ‚îÇ  ‚Üê Summary chips (fixed)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§
‚îÇ üîç [Search by SKU name‚Ä¶         ]       ‚îÇ  ‚Üê Search (fixed)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§

‚îÇ  ‚îÇ SKU | Sub-SKU | Prod | Pre | Avail ‚îÇ ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ     |        |      |     |       ‚îÇ ‚îÇ  ‚Üê Sticky-header scrollable table
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ Widget A | Type 1 | 50 | 5 | 12  ‚îÇ ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ Widget A | Type 2 | 30 | 0 |  0  ‚îÇ ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ ...                               ‚îÇ ‚îÇ

items.title: Header
items.text:
• Title "Live Inventory" (fontWeight: 700)
  • Caption "Real-time material availability for your workflow"

items.title: Summary Chips
items.text:
4 aggregate chips computed from filtered rows (update in real time as search filters):

Chip Value Colour Available Sum of all row.available Teal Reserved Sum of all row.reserved Amber In Transit Sum of all row.inTransit Blue Pre-Processing Sum of all row.preProcessing Grey

These totals change as the user types in the search box.

items.title: Search Bar
items.text:
• OutlinedInput, max-width 400px, white background
  • Filters by row.sku and row.subSkuType (case-insensitive)

items.title: Table
items.text:
MUI Table with size="small" and stickyHeader inside a flex-1 TableContainer with overflow: 'auto'.

Columns:

Column key Label Alignment Colour sku SKU left default subSkuType Sub-SKU Type left default produced Produced center default preProcessing Pre-Proc. center default available Available center Teal reserved Reserved center Amber #F57C00 inTransit In Transit center Blue #1565C0 consumed Consumed center default total Total center default

Column header colours are applied via the color property in the COLUMNS definition.

items.title: Cell Rendering
items.text:
Available column: 

<Typography sx={{ fontWeight: 700, color: row.available > 0 ? PRIMARY : 'text.disabled', fontSize: '0.8125rem' }}>
  {row.available}
</Typography>
- > 0: Bold teal number - === 0: Disabled grey

Reserved column: 

{row.reserved > 0 ? (
  <Chip label={row.reserved} size="small" sx={{ bgcolor: 'rgba(245,124,0,0.1)', color: '#F57C00' }} />
) : <Typography sx={{ color: 'text.disabled' }}>0</Typography>}

In Transit column: Same pattern as Reserved but with blue chip.

Pre-Processing column: 

{row.preProcessing > 0 ? (
  <Chip label={row.preProcessing} size="small" sx={{ bgcolor: '#F5F5F5' }} />
) : row.preProcessing}  // shows 0 as plain text

items.title: Empty State
items.text:
When filtered.length === 0 (no search match): 

No inventory data found

items.title: Table Container Layout
items.text:
The table is inside a Paper variant="outlined" which uses height: '100%' and display: 'flex', flexDirection: 'column'. The TableContainer has flex: 1, minHeight: 0, overflow: 'auto' ‚Äî this is the key that makes the sticky header work within the constrained viewport:

<Box sx={{ flex: 1, minHeight: 0, overflow: 'hidden', px: 2.5, pb: 2 }}>
  <Paper sx={{ height: '100%', display: 'flex', flexDirection: 'column', ... }}>
    <TableContainer sx={{ flex: 1, minHeight: 0, overflow: 'auto' }}>
      <Table stickyHeader>
        ...
      </Table>
    </TableContainer>
  </Paper>
</Box>

The sticky header pins the column labels while scrolling through rows.

items.title: State
items.text:
Variable Type Initial Description search string '' Search filter input

No context reads (uses mockInventory directly ‚Äî in production would be scoped by workflow).

items.title: Totals calculation
items.text:
const totals = filtered.reduce(
  (acc, row) => ({
    produced: acc.produced + row.produced,
    // ... all columns
  }),
  { produced: 0, preProcessing: 0, available: 0, reserved: 0, inTransit: 0, consumed: 0, total: 0 }
);

The summary chips show totals for the filtered dataset, so searching for "Widget" shows only Widget A inventory in the chips.

items.title: Row Hover
items.text:
<TableRow sx={{ '&:hover': { bgcolor: '#F9FAFB' } }}>

Subtle hover highlight for touch accuracy feedback.

items.title: Edge Cases
items.text: Scenario Behaviour Search: no match Empty state message shown; summary chips show all zeros All items available Available chip shows total; no grey "0" values Pre-processing > 0 Shown as grey chip (not teal) to distinguish from available Long SKU name Text wraps (no truncation in table cells)

items.title: Login Page
items.text: Route: /login Component: src/pages/login/LoginPage.tsx Auth: Public (unauthenticated access only ‚Äî redirects to /requester/create if already logged in)

items.title: Purpose
items.text: The login page authenticates the device operator before they can access the MTS tablet interface. It is the first screen presented on a fresh session or after logout. The dark background and station info banner visually reinforce that this is a secure, station-bound device.

  • Full-screen background: TOPBAR_BG = '#263238' (Blue Grey 900)

• 44√ó44px teal square logo with "AF" lettering
  • App name "AtiFLOW" ‚Äî white, 700 weight
  • Sub-label "Operator Terminal v2.0" ‚Äî 50% white opacity

items.title: Station Banner (top of card)
items.text:
Static DEVICE_INFO object: 

const DEVICE_INFO = {
  stationCode: 'STN-R01',
  stationName: 'Assembly Line A ‚Äì Requester',
  network: 'MTS-PROD',
};

  • Background: rgba(0,150,136,0.15) (teal tint)
  • Station name in #4DB6AC
  • Green dot pulse indicator ("Online")
  • In production, this would read from device config / system environment

items.title: Station Code Field
items.text:
• MUI TextField with QrCodeIcon start adornment
  • autoComplete="username" for accessibility
  • darkFieldSx styling: white text on dark background, teal focus ring
  • type="text" (not type="email") ‚Äî station codes are alphanumeric (e.g. STN-R01)

items.title: Password Field
items.text:
• MUI TextField with LockOutlinedIcon start adornment
  • type="password", autoComplete="current-password"
  • Same darkFieldSx styling

items.title: Sign In Button
items.text:
• variant="contained", fullWidth
  • Disabled when either field is empty (!stationCode.trim() || !password.trim())
  • py: 1.5 for 48px effective height (exceeds 44px minimum)
  • fontSize: '0.9375rem', fontWeight: 700

items.title: Error Alert
items.text:
• MUI Alert with severity="error" ‚Äî shown when login() returns false
  • Message: "Invalid Station Code or Password. Please try again."
  • Cleared on each login attempt

items.title: Device Info Footer
items.text:
• Device: STN-R01 on the left ‚Äî small, 30% opacity
  • AtiFLOW v2.0 on the right ‚Äî small, 30% opacity

items.title: State
items.text: Variable Type Initial Description stationCode string '' Station code input value password string '' Password input value error string '' Error message (empty = no error)

items.title: Login Flow
items.text:
User types station code + password
  ‚Üí Button becomes enabled (both non-empty)
  ‚Üí User taps "Sign In"
      ‚Üí handleLogin()
          ‚Üí setError('')
          ‚Üí login(stationCode, password)
              ‚Üí if ok:  navigate('/requester/create')
              ‚Üí if fail: setError('Invalid Station Code or Password...')

items.title: Enter Key Support
items.text: Both text fields have onKeyDown={handleKey} which triggers handleLogin() when e.key === 'Enter'. This supports hardware keyboard entry (barcode scanner, USB keyboard).

items.title: Already Logged In
items.text:
<Route path="/login" element={user ? <Navigate to="/requester/create" replace /> : <LoginPage />} />

If the user navigates to /login while already authenticated, they are immediately redirected. No flash of the login screen.

items.title: Dark Field Styling
items.text:
const darkFieldSx = {
  '& .MuiOutlinedInput-root': {
    color: '#fff',
    '& fieldset': { borderColor: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.2)' },
    '&:hover fieldset': { borderColor: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.4)' },
    '&.Mui-focused fieldset': { borderColor: PRIMARY },
  },
  '& .MuiInputLabel-root': { color: 'rgba(255,255,255,0.5)' },
  '& .MuiInputLabel-root.Mui-focused': { color: PRIMARY },
};

This override makes the standard MUI TextField look correct on the dark login background. Used on both input fields.

items.title: Edge Cases
items.text: Scenario Behaviour Empty station code Sign In button disabled Empty password Sign In button disabled Wrong credentials Red Alert shown, fields retained (user can retry) Enter key in any field Triggers login attempt Already logged in Immediate redirect to Create Request Network offline (future) Currently no offline handling ‚Äî mock login always succeeds

items.title: Material Selection Page
items.text: Route: /requester/material Component: src/pages/requester/MaterialSelectionPage.tsx Auth: Protected Entered from: Create Request (Order Material zone)

items.title: Purpose
items.text: Allows operators to browse all available Sub-SKU types, set desired quantities, and add them to the cart. Supports two view layouts (grid and list) and live search.

items.title: Sub-header
items.text:
• Back arrow (useNavigate(-1))
  • Title "Order Material" + caption "Select Sub-SKU types and quantities"
  • View toggle: ToggleButtonGroup with grid icon and list icon ‚Äî switches between 'grid' and 'list' view modes
  • Checkout button: Visible only when cart.length > 0 ‚Äî shows "Checkout (N)" count and navigates to /requester/checkout

items.title: Search Bar
items.text:
• Full-width OutlinedInput with SearchIcon adornment
  • Background #F8F9FA, padded 9px vertically
  • Filters across: sub-type name, code, and parent skuName (case-insensitive)
  • Instant filtering on every keystroke

items.title: Material Data (Flat List)
items.text:
All materials are flattened from mockMaterials into a single FlatSST[] array:

type FlatSST = SubSKUType & { skuName: string; skuCode: string };

const allSubSkus: FlatSST[] = mockMaterials.flatMap((sku) =>
  sku.subSkuTypes.map((sst) => ({ ...sst, skuName: sku.name, skuCode: sku.code }))
);

This gives 9 items total (from the mock). Each item carries its parent SKU name for display.

items.title: Grid View
items.text: Column width: minmax(280px, 1fr) ‚Äî auto-fill responsive grid. On 1024px width with 20px padding each side, this renders 3 columns.

items.title: Card Structure
items.text:
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê

  • Border: teal when item is in cart, light grey otherwise
  • Background: teal tint when in cart, white otherwise
  • Opacity: 0.6 when blocked (unavailable or pre-processing)

items.title: Status Chip
items.text: State Chip label Colour inPreProcessing Pre-Processing Amber #E65100 available === 0 Unavailable Grey #9E9E9E orderable {available} avail. Teal

items.title: Quantity Stepper
items.text:
• [‚àí] and [+] icon buttons flanking the current quantity value
  • ‚àí disabled when qty <= 1
  • + disabled when qty >= sst.maxQty
  • Both disabled when blocked
  • Button size: 36√ó36px with borderRadius: 0 (for seamless inline stepper appearance)
  • Default quantity per item: 1 (managed by quantities state as Record<string, number>)

items.title: Add / Added Button
items.text:
• Not in cart: variant="contained" teal button with + icon, disabled when blocked
  • In cart: variant="outlined" red button with checkmark icon, label "Added" ‚Äî clicking removes from cart (toggle behaviour)

items.title: List View
items.text:
A compact table-like grid layout inside a Paper card.

Columns: 1fr 110px 80px 140px

Col 1 Col 2 Col 3 Col 4 Material name + code Status chip Qty stepper (compact) Add/Added button
  • Each row has a divider between it and the next
  • Row background: teal tint if in cart, #FAFAFA if blocked, white otherwise
  • Added items have a 6px teal dot indicator next to the name
  • Quantity stepper in list view is more compact: 28px buttons, 32px height

items.title: State
items.text:
Variable Type Initial Description search string '' Search filter input quantities Record<string, number> {} Pending quantities per sub-SKU ID; default 1 viewMode 'grid' \| 'list' 'grid' Display layout mode

Context reads: cart, addToCart, removeFromCart

items.title: Blocking Logic
items.text:
const isBlocked = (sst: SubSKUType) => sst.available === 0 || sst.inPreProcessing;

Both conditions result in the same disabled state. inPreProcessing items may have available > 0 in the data but are still not orderable ‚Äî this is a business rule (the material is ready in quantity but not physically ready for dispatch).

items.title: Add to Cart
items.text:
const handleAdd = (sst: FlatSST) => {
  const item: CartItem = {
    subSkuTypeId: sst.id,
    subSkuTypeName: `${sst.skuName} ‚Äì ${sst.name}`,
    quantity: getQty(sst.id),  // current pending quantity from local state
    maxQty: sst.maxQty,
    skuName: sst.skuName,
  };
  addToCart(item);
};

The subSkuTypeName is pre-formatted as "Parent SKU ‚Äì Sub-type name" (e.g. "Widget A ‚Äì Sub-SKU Type 1") for display in the checkout review.

items.title: Cart Toggle
items.text: Tapping "Added" immediately calls removeFromCart(sst.id). The button reverts to "Add" instantly. Quantities in local state (quantities) are preserved ‚Äî if the operator re-adds the item, the previous quantity is still set.

items.title: Search Empty State
items.text: When filtered.length === 0, a centred empty state text is shown: "No materials match your search".

items.title: Edge Cases
items.text: Scenario Behaviour All items blocked Empty-looking cards, all steppers/buttons disabled Cart has items, user searches Cart button still visible in header (cart state persists) Max qty reached + button disabled; cannot exceed maxQty Item added then search clears it Still in cart (cart is separate from display filter) Back navigation useNavigate(-1) returns to previous route (Create Request)

items.title: Workflow Filtering
items.text:
// First filter: only show requests for the active workflow
const workflowRequests = mockRequests.filter((r) => r.workflowId === activeWorkflow?.id);

// Then apply status tab filter
const filtered = workflowRequests.filter((r) => {
  if (tabIdx === 0) return true;
  return (
    (tabIdx === 1 && r.status === 'pending') ||
    (tabIdx === 2 && (r.status === 'in_progress' || r.status === 'awaiting_confirmation')) ||
    (tabIdx === 3 && r.status === 'completed') ||
    (tabIdx === 4 && (r.status === 'failed' || r.status === 'breakdown'))
  );
});

Switching workflows in the header (via TabletHeader dropdown) will change activeWorkflow.id, causing this component to re-render and show only the new workflow's requests.

items.title: Return Trolley Page
items.text: Route: /requester/return-trolley Component: src/pages/requester/ReturnTrolleyPage.tsx Auth: Protected Entered from: Create Request (Return Trolley zone) Accent colour: Purple #6A1B9A throughout

items.title: Purpose
items.text: Allows operators to schedule a pickup of an empty container (typically a trolley) and return it to storage. The operator identifies the container either by scanning its QR code or entering its details manually.

items.title: Flow Overview
items.text:
ReturnTrolleyPage
  ‚îú‚îÄ method = null     ‚Üí Method Selection screen
  ‚îú‚îÄ method = 'qr'     ‚Üí QR Code flow
  ‚îÇ     ‚îú‚îÄ resolved = null  ‚Üí Scan prompt
  ‚îÇ     ‚îî‚îÄ resolved ‚â† null  ‚Üí DetailCard + Confirm button
  ‚îî‚îÄ method = 'details' ‚Üí Manual Details flow
        ‚îú‚îÄ resolved = null  ‚Üí Input form (Container ID + Type + Sub-type)
        ‚îî‚îÄ resolved ‚â† null  ‚Üí Input form + DetailCard + Confirm button

  submitted = true ‚Üí Success screen (any flow)

All three screens (method selection, QR flow, manual flow) share a common fixed sub-header and fixed footer button. The sub-header back button behaviour differs by screen: - Method selection: useNavigate(-1) (goes back to Create Request) - QR flow: setMethod(null); setResolved(null) (returns to method selection, no history change) - Manual flow: setMethod(null); setResolved(null); setNotFound(false) (returns to method selection)

items.title: Scan Simulation
items.text:
const handleQrScan = () => {
  setQrScanning(true);
  setTimeout(() => {
    setQrScanning(false);
    setResolved(MOCK_CONTAINERS['TR-001']);  // Always resolves to TR-001
  }, 1200);
};

After 1.2 seconds, resolved is set to the TR-001 container details. In production, this would open the device camera and parse the QR payload.

items.title: After Scan
items.text: The dashed scan paper is replaced by <DetailCard />. The footer "Confirm Return Pickup" button becomes enabled.

items.text:
• Container ID field: monospace font (fontFamily: 'monospace', letterSpacing: '0.04em'), placeholder "e.g. TR-001, PL-001", error state when notFound
  • Container Type select: indexes mockContainers; switching resets sub-type
  • Sub-type select: shows subtypes for active container type from mockContainers
  • Look Up Container button: disabled when both containerId is empty AND subtypeId is unset

items.title: handleManualLookup() Logic
items.text:
const handleManualLookup = () => {
  const key = containerId.trim().toUpperCase();
  const found = MOCK_CONTAINERS[key];

  if (found) {
    setResolved(found);           // exact match ‚Äî real data
    setNotFound(false);
  } else {
    // Try to construct from form fields
    const activeContainer = mockContainers[containerTypeIdx];
    const subtype = activeContainer.subtypes.find((s) => s.id === subtypeId);
    if (subtypeId && subtype) {
      setResolved({
        containerId: containerId || `${TYPE_LABELS[activeContainer.type].charAt(0)}-NEW`,
        containerType: TYPE_LABELS[activeContainer.type],
        subtypeName: subtype.name,
        location: 'Unknown ‚Äì manual entry',
        status: 'Empty',
        lastUsed: '‚Äî',
      });
      setNotFound(false);
    } else {
      setNotFound(true);          // Neither ID match nor form complete
    }
  }
};

Three outcomes: 1. ID found in MOCK_CONTAINERS ‚Üí real details shown 2. ID not found but type+sub-type selected ‚Üí synthetic details shown ("Unknown ‚Äì manual entry" location) 3. ID not found and no sub-type ‚Üí notFound = true ‚Üí error helperText shown, resolved stays null

items.title: Purpose
items.text: Provides a visual and tabular view of all staging areas assigned to this device. Operators can: - See which staging cells are occupied, reserved, or empty - Switch between a visual grid layout and a detailed table list - Enter Manage mode to edit individual cell metadata (container ID, type, ageing, notes)

items.title: Area Card
items.text:
• Teal icon box with CalendarViewMonthIcon
  • Name + grid dimensions (e.g. "4R √ó 10C")
  • "View" and "Manage" chips (cosmetic only ‚Äî both navigate to the same AreaDetail)
  • Fill progress bar: height: 6px, teal fill at {fillPct}%
  • fillPct = Math.round((occupied / total) * 100)
  • Stats row: "N occupied ¬∑ N reserved ¬∑ N empty"
  • Two action buttons: "View Grid" (variant="outlined") and "Manage Cells" (variant="contained")
  • Both call setSelectedArea(area) with e.stopPropagation() to prevent double-triggering with card click

The entire card is clickable (onClick={() => setSelectedArea(area)}).

Conditional container fields: The Container Info section (ID, type, sub-type, ageing) only shows when status === 'occupied' || status === 'reserved'. For empty and maintenance, only the Cell State dropdown and Notes field are shown.

Cell State options (with colour dot indicators): - Empty (grey) - Occupied (teal) - Reserved (amber) - Maintenance (red)

On save: handleSaveCell(edit) upserts into edits record by cell.id. Increments savedCount. Closes dialog.

items.text:
Local to AreaDetail:

Variable Type Initial Description displayMode 'view' \| 'manage' 'view' View or manage mode viewLayout 'grid' \| 'list' 'grid' Grid or list layout edits Record<string, CellEdit> {} Unsaved cell edits keyed by cell.id editingCell StagingCell \| null null Cell currently open in dialog savedCount number 0 Cumulative edit saves (for the edits chip)

Local to StagingAreaPage:

Variable Type Initial Description selectedArea StagingArea \| null null Currently viewing area (null = list view)

items.title: Edits are local only
items.text: The edits Record is never written to context or API. Changes are session-scoped ‚Äî navigating away and back resets the staging area to the original mock data. In production, saves would trigger a PATCH to the MTS backend.

items.title: Status override
items.text:
const getStatus = (cell: StagingCell): CellStatus =>
  (edits[cell.id]?.status ?? cell.status) as CellStatus;

The edit record takes precedence over the original cell status for display in both grid and list views and for statistics calculation.

items.title: Edge Cases
items.text: Scenario Behaviour Click edit in view mode Cells are not clickable (cursor: 'default', no onClick) Switch view mode Edits are preserved in edits state Switch to list view Same edits shown in table form Save dialog Cell updates in grid immediately Back from area detail Area list shown; edits are lost Area with 0 occupied cells Fill bar shows 0%, "0 occupied"
